exercises.name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides
Keep your elbows close to your torso and palms facing forward
Curl the weights up toward your shoulders while keeping upper arms stationary
Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement
Lower the weights back down with control
cues: Keep elbows pinned to your sides
Avoid swinging or using momentum
Full range of motion from full extension to full contraction

exercises.name: Barbell Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, gripping the barbell with an underhand grip
Let the bar hang at arm's length in front of your thighs
Curl the bar up toward your shoulders, keeping elbows stationary
Squeeze at the top and lower with control
cues: Keep your back straight, avoid leaning back
Grip should be shoulder-width or slightly wider
Control the negative portion of the lift

exercises.name: EZ Bar Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, gripping the EZ bar on the angled portions
Let the bar hang at arm's length with palms facing slightly inward
Curl the bar up toward your shoulders, keeping elbows close to your body
Squeeze at the top and lower under control
cues: The angled grip reduces wrist strain
Keep elbows stationary throughout the movement
Don't swing the weight

exercises.name: Hammer Curl
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells at your sides with palms facing your body
Keep your elbows close to your torso throughout the movement
Curl the weights up while maintaining the neutral grip (palms facing each other)
Squeeze at the top and lower with control
cues: Maintain neutral wrist position throughout
Great for targeting the brachialis and forearms
Can be done alternating or simultaneously

exercises.name: Concentration Curl
instructions: Sit on a bench with legs spread, holding a dumbbell in one hand
Rest the back of your upper arm against your inner thigh
Curl the weight up toward your shoulder, keeping upper arm stationary
Squeeze at the top and lower with control
Complete all reps on one side before switching
cues: Press your arm firmly against your thigh for stability
Focus on the mind-muscle connection
Avoid rotating your shoulder during the movement

exercises.name: Preacher Curl
instructions: Adjust the preacher bench so your armpits rest at the top of the pad
Grip the EZ bar with an underhand grip and rest your arms on the pad
Curl the bar up toward your shoulders
Lower the weight slowly, stopping just before full extension to maintain tension
cues: Keep your armpits firmly on the pad
Don't let your elbows flare out
Control the descent - don't drop the weight

exercises.name: Cable Bicep Curl
instructions: Attach a straight bar or EZ bar to a low cable pulley
Stand facing the machine and grasp the bar with an underhand grip
Keep your elbows at your sides and curl the bar up toward your shoulders
Squeeze at the top and lower with control
cues: Constant tension throughout the entire range of motion
Stand close enough to maintain cable tension at the bottom
Keep your core engaged

exercises.name: Resistance Band Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand on the center of the resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold the handles with palms facing forward
Curl your hands up toward your shoulders, keeping elbows stationary
Squeeze at the top and lower with control
cues: Resistance increases as you curl higher
Keep wrists straight throughout
Great for home workouts and travel

exercises.name: Chin-Up
instructions: Grip the pull-up bar with palms facing you, hands shoulder-width apart
Hang with arms fully extended
Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar
Lower yourself with control to the starting position
cues: Engage your lats and biceps to initiate the pull
Keep your core tight and avoid swinging
Full extension at the bottom, chin over bar at the top

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Set an adjustable bench to a 45-60 degree incline
Sit back on the bench holding dumbbells at arm's length
Let your arms hang straight down with palms facing forward
Curl the weights up while keeping upper arms stationary
Squeeze at the top and lower with control
cues: The incline provides a greater stretch on the biceps
Don't let your elbows drift forward
Keep your back flat against the bench

exercises.name: Bench Dip
instructions: Sit on the edge of a bench with hands gripping the edge beside your hips
Slide your hips off the bench and extend your legs out in front
Lower your body by bending your elbows to about 90 degrees
Push back up to the starting position
cues: Keep your back close to the bench
Don't flare your elbows too wide
To increase difficulty, elevate your feet on another bench

exercises.name: Parallel Bar Dip
instructions: Grip the parallel bars and lift yourself up with arms fully extended
Keep your torso upright to emphasize triceps (leaning forward shifts focus to chest)
Lower your body by bending your elbows until upper arms are parallel to the floor
Push back up to full arm extension
cues: Keep elbows close to your body for tricep focus
Don't go too deep if you have shoulder issues
Control the descent - don't drop

exercises.name: Overhead Dumbbell Tricep Extension
instructions: Stand or sit holding one dumbbell with both hands
Raise the dumbbell overhead with arms fully extended
Lower the weight behind your head by bending your elbows
Keep your upper arms stationary and close to your head
Extend your arms back to the starting position
cues: Keep your core tight to protect your lower back
Elbows should point forward, not out to the sides
Control the weight - don't let it drop behind your head

exercises.name: Skull Crusher (Lying Tricep Extension)
instructions: Lie on a flat bench holding an EZ bar with arms extended above your chest
Keep your upper arms stationary and perpendicular to the floor
Lower the bar toward your forehead by bending only at the elbows
Stop just before the bar touches your forehead
Extend your arms back to the starting position
cues: Keep upper arms completely still
Control is critical - hence the name
Can also be done with dumbbells

exercises.name: Cable Tricep Pushdown
instructions: Attach a straight bar or rope to a high cable pulley
Stand facing the machine and grasp the attachment with an overhand grip
Keep your elbows pinned to your sides
Push the bar down until your arms are fully extended
Slowly return to the starting position
cues: Don't let your elbows drift forward or back
Squeeze your triceps at the bottom
Keep your torso upright

exercises.name: Rope Tricep Pushdown
instructions: Attach a rope attachment to a high cable pulley
Grasp the rope with a neutral grip (palms facing each other)
Keep your elbows pinned to your sides
Push down and spread the rope apart at the bottom
Slowly return to the starting position
cues: Spread the rope at the bottom for peak contraction
Keep your wrists neutral
Squeeze and hold briefly at full extension

exercises.name: Close-Grip Push-Up
instructions: Start in a push-up position with hands close together (thumbs and index fingers touching to form a diamond, or hands shoulder-width)
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels
Lower your chest toward your hands by bending your elbows
Push back up to the starting position
cues: Keep elbows close to your body
Engage your core throughout
The closer your hands, the more tricep emphasis

exercises.name: Tricep Kickback
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in one hand and hinge forward at the hips
Support yourself with your other hand on a bench or your knee
Bring your upper arm parallel to your torso with elbow bent at 90 degrees
Extend your arm straight back, squeezing your tricep
Return to the bent position with control
cues: Keep your upper arm stationary and parallel to the floor
Squeeze hard at the top of the movement
Use lighter weight with strict form

exercises.name: Overhead Cable Tricep Extension
instructions: Attach a rope to a low cable pulley
Face away from the machine and grasp the rope behind your head
Step forward and lean slightly forward at the hips
Extend your arms overhead until fully straight
Lower the rope back behind your head with control
cues: Keep your upper arms close to your head
Maintain a stable stance throughout
Feel the stretch in your triceps at the bottom

exercises.name: Resistance Band Tricep Extension
instructions: Hold one end of the band and place it behind your back
Grasp the other end with your working arm, elbow bent behind your head
Extend your arm straight up, keeping upper arm stationary
Lower back down with control
cues: Keep your elbow pointing up toward the ceiling
The anchor hand stays still at your lower back
Great for home workouts and warm-ups

exercises.name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit on a bench and rest your forearms on your thighs, palms facing up
Hold dumbbells with your wrists hanging just past your knees
Lower the weights by extending your wrists down
Curl the weights up by flexing your wrists
cues: Keep your forearms pressed against your thighs
Move only at the wrist joint
Use light to moderate weight with high reps

exercises.name: Reverse Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit on a bench and rest your forearms on your thighs, palms facing down
Hold dumbbells with your wrists hanging just past your knees
Lower the weights by flexing your wrists down
Raise the weights by extending your wrists up
cues: Keep your forearms stationary
Use lighter weight than regular wrist curls
Great for balancing forearm development

exercises.name: Reverse Curl
instructions: Stand holding a barbell with an overhand grip (palms facing down)
Let the bar hang at arm's length in front of your thighs
Curl the bar up toward your shoulders, keeping elbows stationary
Lower with control to the starting position
cues: The overhand grip shifts emphasis to forearms and brachialis
Use lighter weight than regular curls
Keep wrists straight throughout

exercises.name: Farmer's Carry
instructions: Stand between two heavy dumbbells or kettlebells
Squat down and grip the weights firmly
Stand up tall with shoulders back and core engaged
Walk forward with controlled steps for the desired distance or time
Set the weights down with control
cues: Keep your shoulders back and down
Walk with short, controlled steps
Squeeze the handles as hard as possible

exercises.name: TRX Bicep Curl
instructions: Face the anchor point and grasp the TRX handles with palms facing up
Lean back with arms extended, body in a straight line
The steeper the angle, the harder the exercise
Curl your body up by bending at the elbows
Keep upper arms stationary and lower with control
cues: Keep your body rigid like a plank
Only your elbows should bend
Walk your feet forward to increase difficulty

exercises.name: TRX Tricep Extension
instructions: Face away from the anchor point and grasp the TRX handles
Lean forward with arms extended in front of you
Lower your body by bending at the elbows, hands coming toward your forehead
Keep upper arms stationary and extend back to the starting position
cues: Keep your body in a straight line throughout
Only your elbows should bend
The steeper the angle, the harder the exercise
